task.title: Managing Registered Objects
task.abstract:
Registered objects ensure the structural code required to support API functions is correctly installed and ready for use.
Through managing the Registered Objects, staff users can:
Create a new object
Enable/Disable objects
Enable/Disable triggers
Disable validationsBefore enabling triggers on a Registered Object, specify the Apex Class in the Registered Object Settings.

step.cmd: Click Objects in the Spark Framework app.
To create a new object, click New Object.
Select the object Name from the picklist and enter the object Namespace and Apex Class. Click Save.
step.info: Optionally, populate the SOQL Limit and SOQL Order By fields.

step.cmd: Check the Is Enabled, Triggers Enabled, and/or Validation Disabled checkboxes.
step.info: The Is Enabled flag activates the newly registered object to use all Framework code functionality, such as triggers and rollup summaries. The Triggers Enabled flag activates the trigger on the newly registered object, and if properly used, will allow the user to activate/deactivate triggers on that particular object in a production environment without a deploy. The Validation Disabled flag disables validations in the Domain class of the object.
step.stepresult: The newly registered object will display in the list of Objects.

step.cmd: Click the Edit action on the related object to review and make changes to the object.
step.info: Enable/disable checkboxes as needed and click Save.
